login.explanation: The tool dedicated to associations wishing to apply the Bilan Carbone® method and its sectoral variant for the associative sphere. It came into being thanks to the partnership between the Association for Low Carbon Transition, which is the holder of the Bilan Carbone® method, and Tilt, which accompanies all associations in their low-carbon transition. The tool is freely accessible for all French associations trained in the method.

signup.description: Create a Tilt account with your email and a Siret
signup.Not authorized: This email is already used for Tilt or there's an issue with the account creation. Please see <link>the FAQ</link> or <support>contact support</support> if you think this is an error.
signup.Not association SIRET: This tool is reserved for associations. Please use the classic version of Bilan Carbone®+

collaborators.title: Pilot Team:
collaborators.message: Find here the list of teachers, administrative staff and students authorized to modify the establishment's data

footprints.title: My Footprints:
footprints.message: Create your first footprint here. You can then view your footprints or create new ones at any time.

sites.title: My association:
sites.message: Find here the list of establishments linked to your account

home.title: Calculating your simplified carbon footprint will allow you to:

subject.newUser: You have been invited on Tilt
subject.addedActiveUser: You have been invited on a new environment Tilt
subject.activation: You have activated you account on Tilt
subject.activationRequest: Access request to your Tilt organization

glossary.etpDescription: This data is used to calculate carbon intensities (kgCO₂e/employee).
glossary.caDescription: This data is used to calculate carbon intensities (kgCO₂e/{unit} CA). Please note that the budget must be entered in thousands of euros (k€).
glossary.volunteerDescription: The number of volunteers entered here will simply be used to calculate the carbon intensity per volunteer, in tCO₂e/volunteer. You can enter the number of volunteers, the number of active volunteers, whether or not to count members of the Board of Directors, etc. The most important thing is not how you choose to count volunteers, but that you use the same method for your future Carbon Footprint® assessments so that you can compare changes in your emissions with changes in your organisation's activities.

flow.info: You can download a sample flow mapping to help you build your own. Afterwards, if you wish to submit your flow mapping so that other users can use it as an example and help other associations, please send it to <mail>methodologie@abc-transitionbascarbone.fr</mail>

dependencyMatrix.info: You can download a sample risk and dependency matrix to help you build your own. Afterwards, if you wish to submit your own matrix to help other associations by providing a working base, please send it to <mail>methodologie@abc-transitionbascarbone.fr</mail>
